00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Class that allows Value.pm objects to be included in formulas
00004 #    (used to store constant Vector values, etc.)
00005 #
00006 package Parser::Value;
00007 use strict; no strict "refs";
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00009 
00010 $Parser::class->{Value} = 'Parser::Value';
00011 
00012 #
00013 #  Get the Value.pm type of the constant
00014 #  Return it if it is an equation
00015 #  Make a new string or number if it is one of those
00016 #  Error if we don't know what it is
00017 #  Otherwise, get a Value object for the item and use it.
00018 #
00019 sub new {
00020   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00021   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00022   my ($value,$ref) = @_;
00023   $value = $value->[0] if ref($value) eq 'ARRAY' && scalar(@{$value}) == 1;
00024   my $type = Value::getType($equation,$value);
00025   return $value->{tree}->copy($equation) if ($type eq 'Formula');
00026   return $self->Item("String",$context)->new($equation,$value,$ref) if ($type eq 'String');
00027   return $self->Item("String",$context)->newInfinity($equation,$value,$ref) if ($type eq 'Infinity');
00028   return $self->Item("Number",$context)->new($equation,$value,$ref) if ($type eq 'Number');
00029   return $self->Item("Number",$context)->new($equation,$value->{data},$ref)
00030     if ($type eq 'value' && $value->class eq 'Complex');
00031   $equation->Error(["Can't convert %s to a constant",Value::showClass($value)],$ref)
00032     if ($type eq 'unknown');
00033   $type = $context->Package($type), $value = $type->new($context,@{$value}) unless $type eq 'value';
00034   $type = $value->typeRef;
00035 
00036   my $c = bless {
00037     value => $value, type => $type, isConstant => 1,
00038     ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00039   }, $class;
00040   $c->weaken;
00041   $c->check;
00042   return $c;
00043 }
00044 
00045 #
00046 #  Set flags for the object
00047 #
00048 sub check {
00049   my $self = shift; my $value = $self->{value};
00050   $self->{isZero} = $value->isZero;
00051   $self->{isOne}  = $value->isOne;
00052 }
00053 
00054 #
00055 #  Return the Value object
00056 #
00057 sub eval {(shift)->{value}}
00058 
00059 #
00060 #  Call the Value object's reduce method and reset the flags
00061 #
00062 sub reduce {
00063   my $self = shift;
00064   $self->{value} = $self->{value}->reduce;
00065   $self->check;
00066   return $self;
00067 }
00068 
00069 #
00070 #  Pass on the request to the Value object
00071 #
00072 sub canBeInUnion {(shift)->{value}->canBeInUnion}
00073 
00074 #
00075 #  Return the item's list of coordinates
00076 #    (for points, vectors, matrices, etc.)
00077 #
00078 sub coords {
00079   my $self = shift;
00080   return [$self->{value}] unless $self->typeRef->{list};
00081   my @coords = (); my $equation = $self->{equation};
00082   my $value = $self->Item("Value");
00083   foreach my $x (@{$self->{value}->data}) {push(@coords,$value->new($equation,[$x]))}
00084   return [@coords];
00085 }
00086 
00087 #
00088 #  Call the appropriate formatter from Value.pm
00089 #
00090 sub string {
00091   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift;
00092   my $string = $self->{value}->string($self->{equation},$self->{open},$self->{close},$precedence);
00093   return $string;
00094 }
00095 sub TeX {
00096   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift;
00097   my $TeX = $self->{value}->TeX($self->{equation},$self->{open},$self->{close},$precedence);
00098   return $TeX;
00099 }
00100 sub perl {
00101   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift; my $matrix = shift;
00102   my $perl = $self->{value}->perl(0,$matrix);
00103   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00104   return $perl;
00105 }

00107 sub ijk {(shift)->{value}->ijk}

00109 #
00110 #  Convert the value to a Matrix object
00111 #
00112 sub makeMatrix {
00113   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00114   my ($name,$open,$close) = @_;
00115   $self->{type}{name} = $name;
00116   $self->{value} = $self->Package("Matrix",$context)->new($context,$self->{value}->value);
00117 }

00120 #  Get a Union object's data
00121 #
00122 sub makeUnion {@{shift->{value}{data}}}
